title: why is warwick being so op and popular all of a sudden
body: i dont quite play jg so im not sure what happened, all i know is that after the new patch, there are 2 warwicks in 1 game always...

replies.body: {{champion:19}} + {{item:3718}} + {{summoner:11}} + Ult = Insane mixed damage (magic/true) each hit from his Ult and while you can QSS to stop the CC it doesn't stop the damage so you can do like 3.4+ damage just from Ult, Q, Smite and BotRK at full build.

> {{champion:19}} + {{item:3718}} + {{summoner:11}} + Ult = Insane mixed damage (magic/true) each hit from his Ult and while you can QSS to stop the CC it doesn't stop the damage so you can do like 3.4+ damage just from Ult, Q, Smite and BotRK at full build.

this

{{item:3718}} Correct combination {{champion:19}} +{{item:3020}} +{{item:3091}} +{{item:3718}} +{{summoner:11}} 

Devourer gives him magic damage on hit, while Warwick may look quite physical his Q and ult pumps out magic damage not physical.

If you have +15 MP shoes plus plus Wit's End, which takes away enemy MR on hit and procs with his ult, it reduces champion with no MR scaling to zero for you to pack a whooper Q after the ult ends. 

That's BEFORE the new jungle, now he gets 50 more magic damage per hit with Devourer when he ults, not a uncommon sight for you to exterminate mid/adc in one hit.

tl;dr his kit has complete sync with what he does, while some other champion only benefit from certain elements of the new items.

Sustain junglers are popular again so people can learn how the new jungle works without accidentally getting executed. Zac, Fiddle, Warwick and Pantheon the most popular.

Also because the new jungle item Devourer is currently OP. Warwick can 1-shot a carry with his Ult.

It's because high sustain champs are the popular picks for the new jungle, and there's no jungler who sustains better than Warwick. Plus low cooldown on a suppression ult, he's always been pretty strong.
